Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.clazz

Class ClassEncryptionPlugin<S,​C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.clazz.ClassEncryptionPlugin<S,​C>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - Type of the shared encryption key class.
    C - Type of the encryption group-specific encryption key class.
    public abstract class ClassEncryptionPlugin<S,​C>
extends java.lang.Object
    Plugin for encrypting and decrypting class files.

    Class encryption is done in two steps:

    • generation of encryption keys;
    • encryption of the actual class data, using the encryption paremeters to configure the encryption algorithm.

    There are two types of encryption keys:

    • shared encryption keys: this key is shared amongst different class encryption groups. DexGuard will automatically group classes during obfuscation;
    • group-specific encryption key: this key is unique to one class encryption group.

    The encryptClasses(OutputStream, Object, Object) and decryptClasses(InputStream, Object, Object) methods should combine both keys to configure the encryption/decryption algorithm.

    The following constraints apply to extensions of this class:

    • Implementations must be stateless. They may define immutable static final constants, but must not define any other fields.
    • Implementations must not define non-static inner classes.
    • Implementations must have a no-argument constructor.
    • Instances of implementing classes must not be passed as arguments to methods.
    • The decryptClasses(InputStream, Object, Object) method must only access fields of the following types in G and A:
      • all primitive types;
      • arrays of primitives;
      • all List, Set and Map implementations of the Java Collections Framework;
      • String, BigInteger and BigDecimal.
    • The decrypt method must not invoke other non-static methods in this class.

    The following constraints apply to encryption key classes (S and A):

    • Encryption key classes must be public.
    • They must be simple container classes that only contain fields, no methods.
    • All their fields should be public or package-visible.
    • They may contain fields of any type, as long as the decryptClasses(InputStream, Object, Object) method only accesses fields of the allowed types (see above). E.g. the private key of a public-private key pair can be stored in a shared encryption key class. DexGuard will automatically remove fields that are only used for encryption.
    • Instances of S must only be created and modified in the createClassSharedEncryptionKey(long, Set) method.
    • Instances of A must only be created and modified in the createClassEncryptionKey(Object, long, Set) method.
    • Instances of S and A must not be passed as arguments to other methods. Their field values can be passed, though.

    The encryption part of this class is executed by DexGuard during obfuscation. The decryption part is integrated in and executed by the application that is processed. This additionally requires that:

    • the following methods must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of DexGuard (i.e., the Java Standard libraries from the JDK):
      • createClassSharedEncryptionKey(long, Set)
      • createClassEncryptionKey(Object, long, Set)
      • encryptClasses(OutputStream, Object, Object)
    • the following method must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of the application (e.g., for Android applications, the Android SDK libraries):
      • decryptClasses(InputStream, Object, Object)
    • the key classes (S and A) must only use API that is available in both obfuscation and application environment.

    • Method Detail

      • createClassSharedEncryptionKey

        public S createClassSharedEncryptionKey​(long sharedSeed,
                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> classNames)
        Creates a shared encryption key. The created key should be deterministic and should only be a function of the provided parameters, i.e., multiple calls to this method with the same arguments should return the same encryption key.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        sharedSeed - a seed for generating the shared encryption key.
        classNames - all classes that will be using the created encryption key.
        Returns:
        properly initialized shared encryption key.

      • createClassEncryptionKey

        public C createClassEncryptionKey​(S sharedEncryptionKey,
                                  long classSeed,
                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> classNames)
        Creates an class group-specific encryption key. The created key should be deterministic and should only be a function of the provided parameters, i.e., multiple calls to this method with the same arguments should return the same encryption key.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        sharedEncryptionKey - the shared encryption key to be used for this class encryption.
        classSeed - a seed for generating the class group encryption key.
        classNames - all classes that will be using the created encryption key.
        Returns:
        properly initialized class group encryption key, initialized for the given class group.

      • encryptClasses

        public abstract java.io.OutputStream encryptClasses​(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                                                    S sharedEncryptionKey,
                                                    C classGroupEncryptionKey)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an encrypted wrapper for the given output stream, using the given shared and class group encryption keys.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - the stream to write encrypted bytes to.
        sharedEncryptionKey - the shared encryption key to use for encryption.
        classGroupEncryptionKey - the class group-specifc encryption key to use for encryption.
        Returns:
        an encrypted wrapper for the given output stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O related exception occurs during encryption.

      • decryptClasses

        public abstract java.io.InputStream decryptClasses​(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                   S sharedEncryptionKey,
                                                   C classGroupEncryptionKey)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a decrypted wrapper for the given input stream, using the given shared and class group encryption keys.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the stream to be decrypted.
        sharedEncryptionKey - the shared encryption key to use for encryption.
        classGroupEncryptionKey - the class group-specifc encryption key to use for encryption.
        Returns:
        a decrypted wrapper for the given input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O related exception occurs during decryption.
